name: Westin San Diego

reviews.text: Came here for a conference. The days are so long that I really like to stay where the conference is. Very nice room- bigger than most. View was great. Clean, fantastic beds, double showers heads are the way to go (there is a way to only use one for those who are trying to save water- but it was delightful). Loved that they let us borrow a hot water dispenser- my mom was very happy with it. Fun elevators with nice views of the lobby and outside depending on which one you used. Nice conference space- well staffed. The bell men and valets were fantastic which is so impt since the parking is crazy at $32/night. The lobby restaurant staff were really sweet and attentive. Food was good there and throughout our conference. Just finished the survey from Westin after the trip and they didn't have a place to write about the good experiences, so I put them here. Excellent location- could easily walk to restaurants, Horton plaza and Seaport village.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Location is really good, only a few minute walk to the Gas Lamp Dist. and close to the bay area. The hotel is nice and modern. with comfortable rooms, the beds are exceptionally comfortable, with good quality bed linen, and very important, comfortable pillows. We were given a very nice room, with large windows that looked over towards the bay. The hotel was quiet at night. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful, and my husband and myself would definitely stay at this Westin hotel again. All in all a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here this past weekend. Booked a room through Priceline and I guess that's why I was given what I guess at one time was a handicapped accessible room on the 5th floor. I checked in with my wife and 4 month old daughter and was promptly given two keys that didn't work. I understand that sometimes this happens but it hadn't happened to me before, and of course we had my daughter and her stroller and all her extra stuff to deal with.
reviews.title: Would've rather stayed anywhere else

reviews.text: After going back downstairs and getting a key that worked we got in the room and could barely squeeze ourselves through the hallway. The doorway opened at an angle and with my daughter's stroller we had to go in the bathroom for a step or two to be able to close the door and enter the room. That might have been why this room is apparently no longer a handicapped accessible room, because there were a couple placard-sized glue stains on the back of the door that showed where signs had been removed.
reviews.title: Amazing Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of those placards would've been nice to explain the door lock on the bathroom. I'll attach a picture of it but it was something I've never seen before, and it looked like a generation-ago relic. My wife actually locked herself in the bathroom and had no idea how to get out for a minute. Not exactly what we expected.
reviews.title: Pack Snacks

reviews.text: I stayed here around early Sept. with my family.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel was very accommodating with our two small pets (both under 10 lbs)
reviews.title: Beautiful Lobby, super clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They were able to provide us with late check out, and very helpful, even with our 1AM arrival time.
reviews.title: Nice stay
Under Rennovation BUT...
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and modern. Our room was very big and impressive. We even got dog beds and bowls. The dog beds looked brand new and I was very impressed.
The bathrooms need some minor maintenance with stains and such. Otherwise, it was enjoyable.
reviews.title: This is a Westin? More like a transition period?

reviews.text: A note first that my 4-star ranking is more about the staff and service than about location and the hotel itself. The hotel is undergoing a major lobby renovation. I would estimate there are two working elevators. The location is near county and federal court, so you can expect a fair amount of San Diego's ever prevalent homeless people hanging in the public spaces.
reviews.title: Under construction in October

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, I thought Melissa at check-in/check-out was fantastic; the concierge services were good, the free airport shuttle is always appreciated and the overall level of service was fine.
reviews.title: Beware of the valet parking - check your car. A dated 'business' hotel.

reviews.text: The swimming pool is long for lap swimmers, but it's not the kind of pool where you will see more than a few people at any time. Bar food was decent, not great.
reviews.title: Good location, antiquated wifi, aging bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Westin as I'm an SPG member and wanted to experience San Diego city, having stayed up in the Del Mar region previously for work. I choose this Westin because of price and it seemed to be the best of the SPG hotels in the area in terms of noise levels (we wanted peace and quiet).
reviews.title: Westin Valet Services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm marking it way down because we had a very unfortunate incident with the valets - we didn't realise we had to check the car after collecting it. We drove off to the zoo, and while parking the car, we noticed some significant damage to the front bumper. When we reported it after getting back to the hotel that afternoon, the manager promised to send up a form that evening (she never did). So we requested to meet with the 'security' manager and the ACE Parking manager the next morning, who agreed that they would investigate. One week later, I get an email from ACE who say damage is denied because it was not reported when it occurred. This is a pretty poor response from Westin (outsourcing your parking does not mean you are absolved of responsibility to your guests); apart from costing us in both time and money, they obviously have dishonest valet staff who do not report incidents, or who cover them up. I never heard any more from Westin.
reviews.title: Very good, but remember there are two Westins in San Diego close by!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Westin for our 29th wedding anniversary and also to attend a wedding in San Diego Harbor. I made our reservations two months or more in advance. We were disappointed to find they were doing construction and the noise was extremely irritating starting at 10 a.m. and going on until 4:30 p.m. I complained to the front desk and they went out of their way to compensate us for the trouble. We were given 5,000 Starwood points (in lieu of a room because we booked through a third party)they sent us a bottle of wonderful red wine and a fruit plate of strawberries and chocolate. None of which we expected but it was such a wonderful treat and certainly made up for the inconvenience of the noise. the room was wonderful and very comfortable beds and pillows. I have been a Westin fan for a while now and will continue to stay there whenever I get the opportunity.
reviews.title: Over The Top Service
great place
reviews.text: stayed here for three days. The location of this hotel is perfect, it's on the main street, and is within walking distance of loads of attractions, restaurants and travel options. room is clean, staff are friendly

This summer I spent four nights at the Westin on business. The hotel was centrally location for my for my business purposes but also a quick walk to both Little Italy and the Gaslamp parts of town which provide a variety of dining and night life options.
reviews.title: Outstanding property

reviews.text: The free airport shuttle was great and ran very frequently – I think roughly every 30 minutes. Staff was friendly and the property has a great program where you can rent exercise shoes and clothing for only $5 which is one less thing I had to pack for my trip. The one downside was my “upgraded” exercise suite. This “upgrade” consisted of an outdated exercise bike sitting in the corner of what appeared to be a normal room. I would have preferred it to have not been in the room or the front desk not announcing it to be some sort of perk.
reviews.title: Glad I chose it...

reviews.text: Overall I'd definately return to this property if staying in downtown San Diego.
reviews.title: Great Service

aka: Westin San Diego Hotel San Diego
description: Westin San Diego's crystalline design is a signature landmark in the city skyline. The sophisticated urban setting begins with the 100-foot high lobby atrium, creating a magnificent sense of arrival.
